channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Anoop Sam John mind to take a look and give some advice?
Where are the new Abstract classes? Missing in the patch!
Oh, very sorry for it.

Mark IA.Private for this AbstractDataBlockEncoder .
Do we need this 'NoDataBlockEncoderUtil'? It is also missing IA.Private annotation.
Can we add a static method in ByteBufferedDataEncoder/AbstractByteBufferedDataEncoder itself and call that from the 3 algo implementations?
Some more code duplicates were there reg the tag compression and tag encoding and decoding? I remember seeing that. May be it is corrected now in the last commits?

Mark IA.Private for this AbstractDataBlockEncoder .

Ok, miss it.

Do we need this 'NoDataBlockEncoderUtil'? It is also missing IA.Private annotation.

I do not know where to put, so add a new class.

Can we add a static method in ByteBufferedDataEncoder/AbstractByteBufferedDataEncoder itself and call that from the 3 algo implementations?

Sorry i do not find ByteBufferedDataEncoder/AbstractByteBufferedDataEncoder.

Some more code duplicates were there reg the tag compression and tag encoding and decoding? I remember seeing that. May be it is corrected now in the last commits?

ROW_INDEX_V1 do not have tag compression now.

Oh sorry for adding ByteBufferedDataEncoder it is
BufferedDataBlockEncoder and AbstractDataBlockEncoder
ok

Thanks for the patch.
I went thro the code and I think instead of this new Util method can we check if we can allow the NoopDataBlockEncoder to be used for this CopyKeyDataBlockEncoder and the new ones? The encoding code wil not be repeated and can be unified.
Any thoughts!!!
OK, let me try it.
How about now?
I think this unification is great. +1 on V4. Will commit this later today unless objections.

-1 overall

+1 on patch v4, checked the failed UT TestDispatchMergingRegionsProcedure on local and it passed, should be irrelative to the changes here.

Pushed to master branch, thanks all for review ramkrishna.s.vasudevan Anoop Sam John

For branch-1, current patch cannot be applied directly. Please supply the branch-1 patch binlijin, thanks.

It seems the post-commit check failed because of below compilation error since Sep. 5th, mind take a look here Boss? Sean Busbey stack

[ERROR] COMPILATION ERROR : 

[INFO] -------------------------------------------------------------

[ERROR] /home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/HBase-Trunk_matrix/jdk/JDK 1.8 (latest)/label/yahoo-not-h2/hbase-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/util/VersionInfo.java:[26,31] cannot find symbol

ok
ok
Appy!

Can you look at the above failure?

I tried running it locally and seems to pass.

This message was automatically generated.

So i found the issue, don't know the fix though.
Version.java is generated by saveVersion.sh which is run by maven-antrun-plugin during generate-sources phase of hbase-common.
In trunk, that phase is failing.

[INFO] --- maven-antrun-plugin:1.8:run (generate) @ hbase-common ---

[INFO] Executing tasks



main:

     [exec] bash: /home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/HBase-Trunk_matrix/jdk/JDK: No such file or directory

     [exec] Result: 127

[INFO] Executed tasks

The culprit is spaces in JDK version name.

This seems like one of the solutions to our problem or spaces. hudson.matrix.MatrixConfiguration.useShortWorkspaceName
But it's global configuration, so not in our hands, and doesn't look like ASF would do such a think for all projects.

the solution is the same as the rest of our build infra headache work arounds: redo the jenkins job as a series of jobs instead of a multi-configuration job. it's ugly and it's unmaintainable but it will work for now.
Reattach patch to retry HadoopQA for branch-1, failed cases in previous run should be irrelative to changes here.
Could see UT runs normally for post-commit now, thanks for the quick response and actions stack Appy Sean Busbey

-1 overall
